thread.title: Obamas relax on Richard Branson’s Moskito Island | Daily Telegraph
thread.title_full: Obamas relax on Richard Branson’s Moskito Island | Daily Telegraph

author: Neal Baker and staff writers
title: Obamas relax on Richard Branson’s Moskito Island | Daily Telegraph
text:
THE rest of the world may be going up in flames, but Barack and Michelle Obama are a picture of relaxation as they stroll through Moskito Island — the private paradise owned by Virgin boss Richard Branson.
The Sun reports that the couple were snapped after arriving on the British Virgin island, near the famous Necker resort , on Branson’s private jet as they enjoy their second week since leaving the White House.
They travelled last week from Palm Springs in California, where they had spent the first part of their holiday as a guest of the Spanish ambassador while Donald Trump took office.
It looks as though the weight of the world has lifted off the couple’s shoulders.
Gone are the navy business suits and glittering Versace gowns.
Video shared on Twitter shows the former president wearing dark shades and wandering along in sandals and waving to the camera.
Oh, and he’s wearing his hat backwards, so naturally Twitter lost its mind.
Meanwhile, The Obamas are having a great time in the Caribbean. Cap backwards!! pic.twitter.com/j1SxKq0QYd
— Yashar (@yashar) February 1, 2017 Seeing Obama on vacation in flip flops with his hat to the back just brought me so much joy ❤❤❤
— mase (@mase_430) February 1, 2017 I am not an undercover cop pic.twitter.com/VBXBtVETHT
— Trill Withers (@TylerIAm) February 1, 2017 Meanwhile, ex-first lady Michelle looks girlish and happy in a blue top with a white throwover and a fedora hat over pigtails, beaming as she explores the island.
She could easily be mistaken for one of her teenage daughters.
Aside from the entourage of an estimated 100 or so Secret Service agents trailing them, they could easily be a young couple returning from a romantic picnic.
And let’s be honest: we’ve all seen West Wing, and we know the leader of the free world survives on an average of about four hours’ sleep a night.
It’s probably the first time either of them has had any decent shut-eye for the better part of eight years, aside from the occasional holiday in Hawaii.
Barack Obama & Michelle Obama spotted out in the British Virgin Islands pic.twitter.com/IhWsoRXbxu
— MEFeater Magazine (@mefeater) February 1, 2017 But while they have been seen enjoying the kickbacks of a break from Washington DC, Mr Obama has lived up to his word after vowing to be vocal if he saw “core issues” under threat from Donald Trump’s presidency.
On Monday the Democrat issued a statement slamming the new President’s so-called ‘Muslim travel ban’, which prohibits entry to the US of travellers and refugees from seven Muslim-majority countries.
He also gave support to protesters taking to the streets and disrupting airports across the US and beyond.
media_camera First Lady Melania Trump, President Donald Trump, former President Barack Obama and former first lady Michelle Obama at the US Capitol after inauguration ceremonies. Picture: AFP
“President Obama is heartened by the level of engagement taking place in communities around the country,” his office said in a statement.
“Citizens exercising their Constitutional right to assemble, organise and have their voices heard by their elected officials is exactly what we expect to see when American values are at stake”, it said.
But there were no further interventions on Tuesday when the Obamas were seen lunching with host Branson and his daughter Holly, 35.
Barack Obama's new job
